ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral symmetrical mild to moderate-severe gradually sloping hearing loss with a history of noise exposure.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity across frequencies.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate subjective benefit and satisfaction with amplification.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic assessment revealed a bilateral symmetrical mild to moderate-severe sensorineural hearing loss with excellent word recognition scores in quiet. Immittance testing was normal. The patient was counseled and fitted with hearing aids using a manufacturer's 'Quick-Fit' protocol without real-ear verification.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical mild to moderate-severe gradually sloping sensorineural hearing loss (thresholds 15-60 dB HL). Unaided audibility index calculated as 0.44.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (32-33 dB HL) consistent with PTA; Word Recognition Scores excellent (92-96% at 70 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally (ECV 1.1-1.3 mL, Peak Y 0.5-0.6 mmho).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Generally within normal limits; slightly elevated at 2000 and 4000 Hz for left ipsilateral and 4000 Hz for left contralateral stimulation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient returned for follow-up reporting no benefit from the devices and requested to terminate the trial. Retrospective analysis indicated the 'Quick-Fit' settings provided insufficient audibility compared to prescriptive targets.

tests.name: Patient Report/Outcome
tests.result_summary: Patient reported devices did not improve ability to understand speech and wished to terminate the trial period.

proposed_items: Smartphone-enabled receiver-in-the-canal (RIC) hearing aids with open domes
Smartphone application for streaming phone calls
Real-Ear Measurement (REM) verification (recommended in discussion to ensure NAL-NL2 targets are met)
counseling_actions: Counseling on use and maintenance of devices
Counseling on the importance of verification (implied by case lesson)

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires audiological management for hearing loss, specifically verified hearing aid fitting.

follow_up_plan.objective: Follow-up appointment to check progress and benefit.

expected_outcome: Patient reported that the devices did not improve his ability to understand speech.
Patient wished to terminate the trial period.
Patient had a negative reaction toward his audiologist and the possible benefit provided by hearing aids.
